sentence.Network_en: The Coastguard needs to decipher garbled messages in a few minutes.
sentence.Network_cn: 海岸警卫队需要在几分钟内解读这些含混不清的信息。

sentence.Network_en: It is a headache to decipher his sloppy penmanship.
sentence.Network_cn: 辨认他的潦草的字迹叫人头痛.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from de- (expressing reversal) + cipher, on the pattern of French déchiffrer

entry.def: If you decipher a piece of writing or a message, you work out what it says, even though it is very difficult to read or understand.

example.ex: I'm still no closer to deciphering the code.
example.tran: 我还是无法破译该密码。

auth_sentence.content: But the mandatory notices can be hard to decipher.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the mandatory notices can be hard to decipher.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the mandatory notices can be hard to decipher.

auth_sentence.content: Truth in advertising would be a lot easier to decipher.
auth_sentence.res_content: Truth in advertising would be a lot easier to decipher.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Truth in advertising would be a lot easier to decipher.

auth_sentence.content: I found it hard at first to decipher his meaning.
auth_sentence.res_content: I found it hard at first to decipher his meaning.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I found it hard at first to decipher his meaning.

means.word_mean: 破译(密码), 辨认(潦草字迹)

sentences.en: Researchers are gradually deciphering the genetic structure found in the cells of organisms.
sentences.cn: 研究者正渐渐破译存于有机体细胞内的基因结构。
